profiles:
Summary Result oriented Information Technology Consultant (Citrix VDI) with over 10 years of experience with emphasis on Systems Administration, Technology deployment and Project Management. Responsible for the deployment of IT projects throughout the entire project lifecycle, including project initiation, project delivery, Client/Team meetings, post implementation review and project close out / handover to Operations team.  
 
Technologies I have worked on: 
 
Citrix XenApp Version – XP/ 4.0/ 4.5/ 5.0/ 6.5 
Citrix XenDesktop Version – 4/ 5.6 
Citrix Provisioning Server – 5.6 
Citrix Netscaler Version – 9/ 10.1 
AppSense Version – 7.0/8.0 
Microsoft Application Virtualization (APP-V) Version – 4.6 
Microsoft Windows Server – 2003/ 2008 
 
Certifications: 
 
Citrix Certified Administrator – XenApp 4.5/ 5.0 
MCP – Microsoft Certified Professional. 
MCSA – Microsoft Certified System Administrator. 
MCSE – Microsoft Certified System Engineer. 
VCA – VMware Certified Associate 
VCP – VMware Certified Professional

ITIL V3 - Foundation Certified Experience Technology Consultant VDI GBM February 2015  – Present (7 months) Bahrain Professional 2 Consultant VDI CSC January 2014  –  February 2015  (1 year 2 months) Noida Area, India The Infrastructure comprises of Citrix XenDesktop Version 5.6 managing almost 2K to 3K VDI Machines. VMware Vsphere 4.0 is used as a Hypervisor. Profiles and user personalization is managed through AppSense version 8.0. Applications are installed locally as well as streamed through Microsoft APP-V version 4.6. Users are accessing the VDI Machines through the Web Interface as well as through Wyse Terminals. Wyse endpoints devices are managed through Wyse Devise Manager (WDM) version 4.7. Subject Matter Expert - Citrix IBM August 2013  –  January 2014  (6 months) Noida Area, India The infrastructure comprises of 4 major farms with approx. 400 – 500 servers. Most of the servers are Vmware virtual machines with base OS of Win2K3 Sp2 and Win 2008 R2. Two citrix farms are built with citrix version 6.0 and 6.5 and other two farms are built with citrix version 4.5. Edgesight is used to monitor and check the performance of citrix servers. Netscaler version 9.3 is used for external user access. Cisco F5 is used for load balance and redirect users to Web Interfaces depending on the region. Windows Group Policy is used to manage the Roaming Profiles. Associate Consultant HCL Technologies July 2012  –  July 2013  (1 year 1 month) Gurgaon, India Responsible for managing the Infrastructure and on-going Technical Projects. Participate in Regular meetings with other Technical Teams to gather and report their observations. Documenting Citrix Project Analysis Report, Know issues which occur regularly during Project Implementation. Holding daily/weekly internal and external meetings with Technical Teams and Business Management. Identify and resolve project/technical Issues. Technical Specialist Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. August 2010  –  July 2013  (3 years) Gurgaon, India Responsible for the delivery of Technical and Procedural activities to customers such as: planning up to execution of Infrastructure Technical Projects. The main focus is to audit production servers or Citrix hardware appliances and compare the build against documented Citrix best practices. Liaising with relevant support teams to ensure they are informed about relevant progress and issues relating to Citrix servers to be handed over for server management to ensure a smooth transition. Abiding by Change Management and Problem Management procedures, including complying with the Service Level Agreements as documented in the Problem Severity matrix. Technical Specialist Citrix HCL Technologies August 2010  –  June 2012  (1 year 11 months) The infrastructure comprises of group of companies merged together with 17 farms with approx. 50-200 Citrix servers each. Citrix Servers version 4 /4.5/ 5 are installed with the base OS of Win2K3 Sp2 and Win 2008. App-V SoftGrid based on Streaming Technology is used to install the applications. The Cache is streamed to Server to troubleshoot and provide access to Citrix users. BigFix is patching and Application deployment Software which is used to patch the citrix Servers and also build a new citrix Server and automatically join the specified Citrix Farm. Windows Group policies are setup and applied to manage Roaming Profiles. Lead IT Ops Clifford Chance LLP February 2009  –  July 2010  (1 year 6 months) Maintaining the data store for the citrix estate and checking for any issues within. Maintaining and monitor load balanced Web interface & its XML broker servers. Troubleshoot the application setting/connectivity related issues in the farm. Deploy packages on the citrix servers via Citrix Installation manager. Managing Printers and Print Drivers in the farm based on the compatibility testing. Deploying the Applications using Citrix Application Streaming technology. Troubleshooting issues related issues in Citrix Access gateway. The reports and reviews customized to match the organization priorities and include statistics such as the number of support calls opened, case status and resolution times. Applying Load Evaluator to Applications and Servers for Load Balancing. Sr Executive IT Ops IBM Daksh Business Process Services Pvt. Ltd February 2006  –  February 2009  (3 years 1 month) Responsible for the Audit (Validation) check for the Active Directory Discrepancies. Responsible for the creation, deletion and updating of Lotus ID, Groups, OUs. Responsible for the modification in policies as per the requirement. Responsible for securing a database using the Access Control List. Analysis and resolve escalated problems within defined SLA & targets. Coordination with Other Teams for resolving the issues. Managing the Datacenter at 186 Location of IBM. Installation and support of all window based operating systems. Installation and troubleshooting of internal software. Monitoring Terminal Licensing servers, Installation of Citrix Terminal Servers. Maintaining and monitor load balanced Web interface, Deploy packages on the citrix servers via Installation Manager. Managing Printers and Print Drivers in the farm. IT Specialist iLocus June 2004  –  January 2006  (1 year 8 months) Srinagar Area, India Creating and managing computer accounts in an active directory environment. Identify and modify the scope of a group. Manage share folder permission and disk quotas. Control access to different files and folders by applying permission. Plan an organizational unit (OU) structure based on delegation requirements and move objects within and OU hierarchy. Fault Management and Monitor, handle and resolve faults that may occur in the network elements (Switches, Routers), using Network Operation Centre platforms. Follow up fault tickets; solve problems within specified time (according to SLA). Follow up on actions and measures taken by related teams to resolve outstanding issues. Summary To work in a challenging environment where I can get exposure and opportunities to learn, in the field of Citrix and Cloud, to become all kind of challenges that would come my way to prove myself as a successful Citrix engineer by utilizing my full potential. 
 
Experience Summary 
Currently working in IBM India as Subject Matter Expert Citrix. 
8 Plus years of experience in IT. 
 
Specialties: CITRIX, XENAPP 6.5, WINDOWS SERVER 2003/2008 R2, AD, GPO, DHCP, DNS, IIS,VMWARE.
